TEXT: The applicants , PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE and live in GPE and PERSON respectively . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , ORG Attorney - General .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicants’ father Mr PERSON was convicted and sentenced to CARDINAL months’ deprivation of liberty and to forfeiture of immovable and movable property to the ORG ( a house , several fields , forests , electric mill , etc . ) .
On DATE , further to the ORG request , ORG filed a request for legality with ORG in order to challenge the applicants’ father ’s conviction .

At the material time , Section CARDINAL of the DATE LAW as then applicable ( “ the DATE LAW ) regulated the restitution of , and compensation for , the property forfeited through penal proceedings ( see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” ) .
The applicants then filed a request for restitution of confiscated property also with the local authorities – the Community of Trebnje . The latter forwarded the request to the ORG mesto ORG , ORG .
However , on DATE the Novo mesto ORG , ORG , forwarded the request to ORG . On DATE the latter , further to LAW , sent the request back to the Novo mesto ORG , ORG .

On DATE LAW ( “ the DA ” ) was adopted , forming the basis for restitution of property ( or its value ) that had passed into ORG ownership after the Second World War . Its Section CARDINAL provided that property forfeited in criminal proceedings that had terminated before DATE should also be returned to previous owners under the DA ( see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” ) . CARDINAL individual filed a constitutional initiative ( ustavna pobuda ) with the Constitutional Court challenging the constitutionality of LAW .

Following the adoption of the ORG , on DATE the Novo mesto ORG , ORG decided that it lacked jurisdiction to examine the claim , since the administrative authorities enjoyed jurisdiction over denationalisation matters .

In DATE and DATE several individuals filed a constitutional initiative challenging LAW before ORG on the ground that its provisions were retroactive and discriminatory . On DATE ORG dismissed the initiative ( decision no . U - I-CARDINAL/CARDINAL - see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” ) .

LAW , as amended ( Zakon o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) originally excluded from restitution all those sentenced before DATE .
“ If the sanction of forfeiture of property is quashed , the forfeited property shall be restored to the person sentenced or his heirs .

If the restitution of property in whole or in part is physically or legally impossible , the actual value of that property at the time of the decision on its restitution , and according to the state of the property at the time of forfeiture , shall be paid by the socio - political unit to which the property was allocated . ( ... ) ”
The CARDINAL LAW ( Official Journal no . CARDINAL ) replaced LAW .

LAW ( Zakon o denacionalizaciji , ORG no . CARDINAL ) formed the basis for restitution of property ( or its value ) that had passed into ORG ownership through previous legislation ( agrarian reform , nationalisation , confiscation , etc . ) .

Section CARDINAL provides that all natural persons whose property had passed into ORG ownership on the basis of the listed legislation adopted in the aftermath of the Second World War are entitled to denationalisation . LAW further specifies that all other natural persons whose property was nationalised before DATE are entitled to denationalisation .
Sections CARDINAL and DATE to CARDINAL provide that , where property can not be returned in its original form , compensation is payable ( not in cash but in ORG bonds payable in instalments DATE ) .

Section CARDINAL of the DATE Act extended its provisions to property forfeited in criminal proceedings that had terminated by DATE . That provision was rescinded by ORG on DATE , partly on the ground that it was retroactive and therefore violated LAW ( decision no . ORG ) .
CARDINAL . LAW on the Temporary Suspension of Certain Provisions of the Act on Denationalisation and of LAW

Section CARDINAL of LAW on the Temporary Suspension of Certain Provisions of the Act on Denationalisation and of LAW ( Zakon o začasnem zadržanju izvajanja nekaterih določb zakona o denacionalizaciji in zakona o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) suspended , inter alia , originally until DATE and subsequently , under new legislation , until DATE , those proceedings concerning claims for the restitution of or payment of compensation for property confiscated by virtue of criminal judgments handed down before DATE and subsequently annulled .
CARDINAL . LAW of , and Supplements to , LAW
The DATE LAW of , and Supplements to , LAW ( Zakon o spremembah in dopolnitvah PERSON o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij , ORG no . CARDINAL ) made minor amendments to LAW .

It also added new ORG and CARDINALC to LAW . As far as the criminal proceedings terminated before DATE are concerned , ORG replaced LAW , applying the provisions of the ORG regarding the form and scope of restitution as well as the restrictions on restitution and the valuation of property to claims for restitution of forfeited property . Section CARDINALC expressly removed the right to compensation for the previous owner ’s inability to make use of the property during the period of forfeiture .

Section CARDINAL made the change applicable in non - contentious and contentious proceedings concerning the restitution of confiscated property when such proceedings commenced before the LAW came into force , but had not become final by that time .

In DATE , further to ORG ruling of DATE , Section CARDINAL was amended again so that persons entitled under ORG might claim compensation for being unable to use or to manage the property or for loss of earnings incurred throughout the period running from the quashing of the forfeiture of the property until the decision on its restitution becomes final .
The following provisions of LAW ( PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL ) are relevant here :

“ In GPE everyone shall be guaranteed equal human rights and fundamental freedoms irrespective of national origin , race , sex , language , religion , political or other conviction , material standing , birth , education , social status or any other personal circumstance .
All are equal before the law . ”
“ Human rights and fundamental freedoms shall be exercised directly on the basis of the LAW .

The manner in which human rights and fundamental freedoms are exercised may be regulated by law whenever the LAW so provides or where this is necessary due to the particular nature of an individual right or freedom .
Human rights and fundamental freedoms shall be restricted only by the rights of others and in such cases as are provided by LAW .
Legal protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms , and the right to obtain redress for the violation of such rights and freedoms , shall be guaranteed .

No human right or fundamental freedom regulated by legal acts in force in GPE may be restricted on the ground that this LAW does not recognise that right or freedom or recognises it to a lesser degree . ”

“ Everyone shall be guaranteed equal protection of rights in any proceeding before a court and before other state authorities , local community authorities and bearers of public authority that decide on his or her rights , duties or legal interests . ”
“ Everyone has the right to have any decision regarding his rights , duties and any charges brought against him made without undue delay by an independent , impartial court constituted by law .
Only a judge duly appointed pursuant to rules previously established by law and by judicial regulations may judge such an individual . ”

“ Everyone shall have the right to compensation for damage caused by the unlawful acts of a person or body when performing a function or engaged in an activity on behalf of a state or local authority or as a holder of public office ... ”
“ Any person unjustly convicted of a criminal offence or deprived of his liberty without due cause has the right to rehabilitation and compensation , and other rights provided by law . ”
“ The right to private property and inheritance shall be guaranteed . ”
“ Laws and other regulations and general legal acts can not have retroactive effect .
Only a law may establish that certain of its provisions have retroactive effect , if this is required in the public interest and provided that no acquired rights are infringed thereby . ”
“ The Constitutional Court shall hear :
... constitutional appeals in which specific acts are alleged to have infringed a human right or fundamental freedom ; ...

Unless otherwise provided by law , the Constitutional Court shall hear a constitutional appeal only if legal remedies have been exhausted . The Constitutional Court shall decide whether a constitutional appeal is admissible for adjudication on the basis of statutory criteria and procedures . ”
In DATE and DATE several individuals challenged the DATE Act by constitutional initiative ( ustavna pobuda ) before ORG on the ground that its provisions were retroactive and discriminatory .

On DATE , ORG ruled ( a joined decision no . U - I-CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) that the disputed provisions of Sections CARDINALA and CARDINAL of the DATE Act did not conflict with the LAW because such interference with the constitutional rights granted in LAW ( right to rehabilitation and compensation in criminal proceedings ) and CARDINAL ( right to own and inherit property ) of the LAW was indispensable for the protection of the rights of other claimants under the ORG .

Placing unjustly convicted persons on an equal footing with all other rightful claimants regarding the redress of post - war wrongs was an appropriate means through which the legislator had achieved his aim . The principle of the Welfare State empowered the legislator , with due consideration paid to the right of all citizens to social security , to have regard to the financial resources of the ORG and , in cases which were constitutionally admissible , also to restrict certain rights accordingly .

ORG also added that , when deciding , in DATE ( decision no . ORG ) , to quash LAW , it had been unaware of the full extent of the property forfeited through criminal proceedings prior to DATE and thus also of the financial obligations incumbent on the ORG .

ORG ruled that LAW was in conformity with the LAW notwithstanding the fact that it retroactively interfered with acquired rights because the retroactive effect of the LAW was justified by the public interest , and since such interference , provided it be subjected to rigorous constitutional scrutiny , was in conformity with paragraph CARDINAL of LAW .

ORG also emphasised the need , in the light of LAW and LAW , for swift completion of pending cases , all the more so as the restitution of property had twice been delayed by law and that the matter required an early solution .

On DATE , ORG ruled that exclusion of claims for compensation for the inability to use or manage the property or in respect of lost profits for the period running from the quashing of the sentence of forfeiture until the decision on restitution became final was unconstitutional . In DATE , the ORG adopted a new wording of Section CARDINALC.
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ initiative challenging ORG and CARDINAL of the amended CARDINAL Act and on DATE ORG rejected another initiative lodged by the applicants .

The LAW on the Protection of the Right to a Trial without undue Delay ( Zakon o varstvu pravice do sojenja brez nepotrebnega odlašanja , ORG , No . DATE ) has been implemented since DATE . Under its sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL , the right to a trial within a reasonable time is guaranteed for a party to court proceedings , a participant under the LAW governing non - contentious proceedings and an injured party in criminal proceedings .

Section CARDINAL provides for CARDINAL remedies to expedite pending proceedings - a supervisory appeal ( nadzorstvena pritožba ) and a motion for a deadline ( rokovni predlog ) - and , ultimately , for a claim for just satisfaction in respect of damage sustained because of the undue delay ( zahteva za pravično zadoščenje ) .
